questiontext.text: What is the primary principle of informed consent in survey research

answer.text: participants should be given a financial incentive to complete the survey
participants should be aware of the surveys purpose how their data will be used and their right to withdraw at any time
researchers should complete the survey on behalf of the participants if they are unable to
participants do not need to know the purpose of the survey as long as it is voluntary

generalfeedback.text: Informed consent is critical for ethical survey practices. To learn more about informed consent, visit the Wikipedia page on Informed Consent here.

questiontext.text: Which of the following practices is NOT considered ethical when conducting a survey

answer.text: anonymizing responses to protect participant identity
using leading questions to manipulate participant responses
providing participants with the option to skip questions they do not want to answer

generalfeedback.text: The use of leading questions can compromise survey integrity. For further information regarding ethical survey practices, please refer to the Wikipedia page on Survey Research Ethics here.

questiontext.text: Which of the following is an important ethical consideration when collecting sensitive data in surveys

answer.text: collecting all available data regardless of its sensitivity
requiring participants to provide their real names and contact information
ensuring data is securely stored and only accessible to authorized personnel
framing sensitive questions in a way that pressures participants to answer truthfully

generalfeedback.text: Ensuring data security is vital when handling sensitive information in surveys. For more details, you can visit the Wikipedia page on Data Privacy here.

questiontext.text: What should a researcher do if a survey participant expresses discomfort during the survey process

answer.text: ignore the participants discomfort and continue with the survey
offer a monetary incentive to encourage them to participate
allow the participant to skip or withdraw from the survey without penalty
convince the participant that their discomfort is unfounded and proceed with the survey

generalfeedback.text: Addressing participant discomfort is essential for ethical research. For additional insights, visit the Wikipedia page on Ethical Research Standards here.
